KH.content: in On the Social Contract, a form of fiction, war serves to throw light on limits of social contract [and Rousseau's’ fabulous text as well]
KH.linkedContent: in On the Social Contract, a form of fiction, war serves to throw light on limits of social contract [and Rousseau's’ fabulous text as well]

MPM.content: for de Man, Rousseau & Nietzsche both derive transcendental-referent from possibility of making promises [think futurity] [Derrida’s distress over loving both]
MPM.linkedContent: for de Man, Rousseau & Nietzsche both derive transcendental-referent from possibility of making promises [think futurity] [Derrida’s distress over loving both]

TC.content: in The Social Contract and Letter to M. d’Alembert, Rousseau suspects the “representer” when proposing that theatrical representations be replaced by public festivals
TC.linkedContent: in The Social Contract and Letter to M. d’Alembert, Rousseau suspects the “representer” when proposing that theatrical representations be replaced by public festivals

DS.content: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture
DS.linkedContent: supplement in Mallarmé (not unilateral movement, like in Rousseau, which loses warmth of spoken word): c’est l’excès d’un signifiant qui, en son dedans, supplée l’espace et répète l’ouverture

DST.content: de Man’s “no blind spot (tache aveugle)” in Rousseau made Derrida impatient > but impatience should incite one to take one’s time, impatience is never justified
DST.linkedContent: de Man’s “no blind spot (tache aveugle)” in Rousseau made Derrida impatient > but impatience should incite one to take one’s time, impatience is never justified

TR.content: Rousseau: “this is the only portrait of a man, drawn precisely from nature and in all its truth”
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau: “this is the only portrait of a man, drawn precisely from nature and in all its truth”

TR.content: Rousseau’s scene of virtual “sooner or later” remains fundamentally Christian
TR.linkedContent: Rousseau’s scene of virtual “sooner or later” remains fundamentally Christian

TR.content: Rousseau’s appeal to others, appeal to future, belongs to same time, same moment, as “myself alone”

TR.content: Rousseau’s wager, incalculability of absolute perhaps in which contradiction btwn exemplarity & “without example” can survive

AFR.content: reference to Rousseau’s objection to Condillac in 2nd Discourse: Rousseau denounces [turns of Condillac’s] circle only to step into it more quickly
AFR.linkedContent: reference to Rousseau’s objection to Condillac in 2nd Discourse: Rousseau denounces [turns of Condillac’s] circle only to step into it more quickly

OG.content: Descartes drove out sign, Hegel reappropriates sensible sign to movement of Idea, but only Rousseau dealt directly w/ reduction of writing
OG.linkedContent: Descartes drove out sign, Hegel reappropriates sensible sign to movement of Idea, but only Rousseau dealt directly w/ reduction of writing

OG.content: Leibniz’s pasigraphy, non-European scripts, inspired a breach which Rousseau sought to fill w/ the voice > a battle is declared, “Hegelianism” en sera la plus belle cicatrice
OG.linkedContent: Leibniz’s pasigraphy, non-European scripts, inspired a breach which Rousseau sought to fill w/ the voice > a battle is declared, “Hegelianism” en sera la plus belle cicatrice

OG.content: for Lévi-Strauss, Rousseau founder/prophet of anthropology; Rousseau identified possibility of totemism in pity & metaphoricity
OG.linkedContent: for Lévi-Strauss, Rousseau founder/prophet of anthropology; Rousseau identified possibility of totemism in pity & metaphoricity

OG.content: Rousseau: philosophy/reason introduces self-love, philosophy permits man to speak in secret—“‘perish if you will, I’m secure’”
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: philosophy/reason introduces self-love, philosophy permits man to speak in secret—“‘perish if you will, I’m secure’”

OG.content: for Rousseau, the sensible cogito, interior voice, never lies
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, the sensible cogito, interior voice, never lies

OG.content: re: Lévi-Strauss, Rousseau would have shuddered to hear a self-proclaimed disciple describe law as follows… [when everyone can read, “ignorance of law is no defence”]

OG.content: Rousseau tries to recuperate living speech through older writing? writing promises a reappropriation of that of which speech allowed itself to be dispossessed
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau tries to recuperate living speech through older writing? writing promises a reappropriation of that of which speech allowed itself to be dispossessed

OG.content: writing as hiding, solitude, when full speech seems impossible
OG.linkedContent: writing as hiding, solitude, when full speech seems impossible

OG.content: Rousseau’s sacrifice: never began to live until he looked upon himself as a dead man, until he affirmed writing [death in life, differance] > aiming at a symbolic reappropriation of presence that differance will have breached/broached
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau’s sacrifice: never began to live until he looked upon himself as a dead man, until he affirmed writing [death in life, differance] > aiming at a symbolic reappropriation of presence that differance will have breached/broached

OG.content: Rousseau contra Hobbes: pity/compassion is a natural law (beasts have it too), mother’s law, law of the (soft) voice, pity “takes the place of” instituted law, supplements law [though it works the other way around too]; mother’s law, written in our hearts by God > natural writing, writing of heart—not reason, before reason: writing (of reason) is w/out pity, transgresses law of voice, a perverse passion
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau contra Hobbes: pity/compassion is a natural law (beasts have it too), mother’s law, law of the (soft) voice, pity “takes the place of” instituted law, supplements law [though it works the other way around too]; mother’s law, written in our hearts by God > natural writing, writing of heart—not reason, before reason: writing (of reason) is w/out pity, transgresses law of voice, a perverse passion

OG.content: Nietzsche & Rousseau share same opinion of women (degradation of culture), and of genealogy of morals as servitude to slave—so how could Nietzsche have hated him so much?
OG.linkedContent: Nietzsche & Rousseau share same opinion of women (degradation of culture), and of genealogy of morals as servitude to slave—so how could Nietzsche have hated him so much?

OG.content: Rousseau’s inflection of Hobbes: during barbaric times state of war reigned, but men rarely met, earth at peace [neutral origin of ethico-political conceptuality]

OG.content: Rousseau & Descartes [Aristotle too]: our senses never deceive us, only our judgments
